member.name: T:SharedPluginFeatures.SystemAdminSubMenu
member.summary:
Abstract class that plugin modules can implement in order to add menu items the the SystemAdmin.Plugin module.
The SystemAdmin.Plugin module is used to display statistical information in many forms as provided by AspNetCore.PluginManager and any plugins which wish to provide instant statistics for site owners.
Typical useage is to display timing statistics by implementing Timings class, through to showing custom data or even data shown within a map, as UserSessionMiddleware.Plugin does.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.SystemAdminSubMenu.Area
member.summary:
Area in which the implementation exists, or empty string if not contained within an area.
This value will be used to form part of the Url when the menu is clicked.
member.returns: string. area name or empty string.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.SystemAdminSubMenu.Controller
member.summary:
Name of the controller that implements the menu.
This value will be used to form part of the Url when the menu is clicked.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.SystemAdminSubMenu.Action
member.summary: Name of the action that will be called when the user clicks the menu item.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.SystemAdminSubMenu.Name
member.summary: Name of the menu, this can also be the name of a Localized string.
member.returns: string. Display name for menu item.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.SystemAdminSubMenu.SortOrder
member.summary: Sort order for menu item.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.SystemAdminSubMenu.MenuType
member.summary: Type of menu item being displayed, this is used internally to display the Data provided.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.SystemAdminSubMenu.Image
member.summary: Image url to be displayed with the menu item, a default image is provided if the image does not exist.
member.returns: string. Url of image or empty string.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.SystemAdminSubMenu.Data
member.summary: The data to be shown when the menu item is clicked.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.SystemAdminSubMenu.ParentMenuName
member.summary: Name of the parent view where the menu item will be displayed.

member.summary: Back color that will be displayed for the menu item.

member.summary: Forecolor that will be displayed for the menu item.

member.summary: IComparable implementation used to sort menu items by SortOrder then Name

Allows the route to specify a route to the login page that will be used.

member.summary: The url of the page the user will be redirected to, in order to login and gain access to the route where the attribute was applied.

member.name: T:SharedPluginFeatures.LoggedInOutAttribute
member.summary:
This attribute is used in conjunction with the UserSessionMiddleware.Plugin module and indicates that a user can be either logged in or out when attempting to navigate to the route.
This attribute would be used if a LoggedInAttribute or LoggedOutAttribute is defined on the controller, but a specific method is allowed regardless of the user logged in stats.

member.name: T:SharedPluginFeatures.LoggedOutAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is used in conjunction with the UserSessionMiddleware.Plugin module and indicates that a user must be logged out when attempting to gain access to the route.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.LoggedOutAttribute.#ctor
member.summary:
Default constructor
If a logged in user attempts to enter the route, they will be sent to the site home page (/)

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.LoggedOutAttribute.#ctor(System.String@)
member.summary:
Constructor
Allows the developer to specify a page that the user will be redirected to if the attempt to navigate to the route whilst logged in.
member.param: string. Url of route the user will be redirected to.

member.name: P:SharedPluginFeatures.LoggedOutAttribute.RedirectPage
member.summary: Url of the page the user will be redirected to, should they be logged into the system and attempt to access the route.

member.name: T:SharedPluginFeatures.IGeoIpStatisticsUpdate
member.summary:
This interface is implemented internally by the GeoIpPlugin module and is not available via DI or any other method. Instead it is used to provide information on hown many GeoIp records were loaded and how long it took.
See IGeoIpStatistics for information on retrieving statistics.
This method is deprecated and should not be used by new modules as it will be removed in future versions.

member.summary: Indicates that retrieval is finished
member.param: Total number of milliseconds taken to load the data.

member.name: T:SharedPluginFeatures.IInitialiseEvents
member.summary:
Provides initialisation events that can be used by plugins to affect the configuration of services and the application.
This interface is designed to give pre and post notifications, each plugin module that implements IPlugin will automatically receive the events as part of initialisation.
This is particularly useful should a plugin module wish to register an interface for example that is required when another plugin module is being configured or to provide a default implementation of an interface should no plugin have registered one whilst being configured.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.IInitialiseEvents.BeforeConfigure(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.IApplicationBuilder@)
member.summary: Indicates that the Configure method will be called on IPlugin instances.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.IInitialiseEvents.AfterConfigure(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.IApplicationBuilder@)
member.summary: Indicates that all plugins have had an opportunity to load configuration data.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.IInitialiseEvents.Configure(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.IApplicationBuilder@)
member.summary: Indicates that the plugin should configure itself with the ApplicationBuilder

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.IInitialiseEvents.BeforeConfigureServices(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection@)
member.summary: Indicates that the ConfigureServices method on each IPlugin implementation will be called.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.IInitialiseEvents.AfterConfigureServices(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection@)
member.summary: Indicates that all IPlugin instances have had an opportunity to configure services.

member.name: T:SharedPluginFeatures.IIpManagement
member.summary:
This interface is implemented by the BadEgg.Plugin module and is used to manage black and white listed Ip addresses.
BadEgg Plugin module does not store any of these Ip addresses but requires that the host application informs it which Ip addresses are black or white listed.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.IIpManagement.AddBlackListedIp(System.String@)
member.summary: Adds an address to the black listed address list. Any request from an Ip address in this list will be rejected whilst the pipeline is iterated when a request is made.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.IIpManagement.AddWhiteListedIp(System.String@)
member.summary: Adds an address to the whilte listed address list. Any request from an Ip address in this list will never be rejected when making a request to the application.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.IIpManagement.RemoveIpAddress(System.String@)
member.summary: Removes an Ip address from both the black and whilte address lists.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.IIpManagement.ClearAllIpAddresses
member.summary: Removes all Ip addresses from both black and white lists.

member.name: T:SharedPluginFeatures.IIpValidation
member.summary:
This interface should be implemented by the host application and provides a conduit for notifications events for Ip addresses being monitored within BadEgg.Plugin module.
This interface, when implemented can be used by applications to evaluate how Ip addresses are behaving whilst navigating their website.
See BadEgg.Plugin and BadEggAttribute for information on how to validate routes within an application.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.IIpValidation.ConnectionAdd(System.String@)
member.summary: Indicates a new connection has been made by a client Ip.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.IIpValidation.ConnectionRemove(System.String@,System.Double@,System.UInt64@,System.TimeSpan@)
member.summary: Indicates that a connection has expired and is about to be removed. Host applications can evaluate how the Ip used the website and
member.param: Average number of hits per minute.
Total time the client was active within the website.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.IIpValidation.ConnectionReport(System.String@,System.String@,SharedPluginFeatures.Enums.ValidateRequestResult@)
member.summary: Provides a report on the connection after it has been validated.
member.param: Query and form data that was validated.

member.name: T:SharedPluginFeatures.IMemoryCache
member.summary: MemoryCachePlugin implements an instance of IMemoryCache, and add the instance to the DI container. Plugins and other modules can obtain an instance of IMemoryCache which can be used to store and retrieve items easily from a designated cache.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.IMemoryCache.GetShortCache
member.summary:
The short cache is inteded to hold items for upto 5 minutes, after which items will expire.
This can be useful for storing short term items like price information etc, that could change regularly.
There is no limit to the items that can be cached and cache retrieval is extremely quick.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.IMemoryCache.GetCache
member.summary:
The long cache is inteded to hold items for upto 2 hours, after which items will expire.
This can be useful for storing medium term items like product information etc, that doesn't change too regularly but will help speed up requests when retrieving.
There is no limit to the items that can be cached and cache retrieval is extremely quick.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.IMemoryCache.GetExtendingCache
member.summary:
The extending cache is intended to cache items for 2 hours, after which items will expire.
The difference between the extending cache and normal cache is that if an item is requested the time until expire will be extended by a further 2 hours.
There is no limit to the items that can be cached and cache retrieval is extremely quick.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.IMemoryCache.GetPermanentCache
member.summary:
The permanent cache holds items in memory indefinitely.
There is no limit to the items that can be cached and cache retrieval is extremely quick.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.IMemoryCache.ResetCaches
member.summary: Resets all caches, clears all items.

member.param: Culture being used by the user.

member.name: T:SharedPluginFeatures.IUserSessionService
member.summary:
Provides an interface for saving UserSession data.
This interface needs to be implemented by the host application which can control how the session data is stored for the application. The implementation must be registered as a service available usind IoC through the default DI container.
Session data is managed by it's own thread and all implementation of this method must be thread safe.
By using a seperate thread the current pipeline requests are not delayed waiting for data to be saved.
When implementing these methods, the hosting class must update the SaveStatus property for the session and page data.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.IUserSessionService.Save(Shared.Classes.UserSession@)
member.summary: Indicates the current session requires saving.
member.param: UserSession that needs to be saved.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.IUserSessionService.Retrieve(System.String@,Shared.Classes.UserSession@)
member.summary: Requests that a previously saved session is loaded. Mostly used if implemented within a web farm and the users request is passed to a different server for processing.
member.param: UserSession instance that should be populated with user session data.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.IUserSessionService.Closing(Shared.Classes.UserSession@)
member.summary: Indicates the current session has expired and will be removed from the list of monitored sessions and may require saving.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.IUserSessionService.SavePage(Shared.Classes.UserSession@)
member.summary:
Indicates tha page views requires saving.
When implementing this methods, the hosting class must update the SaveStatus property for the session and page data.

member.name: M:SharedPluginFeatures.IUserSessionService.Created(Shared.Classes.UserSession@)
member.summary:
Indicates a session has been created and needs to be saved.
When implementing this methods, the hosting class must update the SaveStatus property for the session and page data.
